00:00:01:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:01:070000.Dialogue: No, see, the liquid metal Terminators were created in the future by Skynet, and Skynet was developed by Miles Dyson, but that future no longer exists due to Dyson's death in Terminator 2.

00:00:14:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:14:120000.Dialogue: Assuming all the good Terminators were originally evil Terminators created by Skynet but then reprogrammed by the future John Connor, why would Skynet, an artificial computer intelligence, bother to create a petite, hot, 17-year-old killer robot?

00:00:30:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:30:110000.Dialogue: Skynet is kinky? I don't know...

00:00:33:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:33:120000.Dialogue: Artificial intelligences do not have teen fetishes.

00:00:58:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:58:170000.Dialogue: I don't know, but if cats could sing... they'd hate it, too.

00:01:41:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:41:060000.Dialogue: You'll never guess what just happened.

00:01:44:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:44:050000.Dialogue: I don't guess. As a scientist, I reach conclusions based on observation and experimentation. Although as I'm saying this, it occurs to me you may have been employing a rhetorical device rendering my response moot.

00:02:00:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:00:230000.Dialogue: Remember when I auditioned for that workshop production of Rent, but I didn't get it and I didn't know why.

00:02:05:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:05:070000.Dialogue: I have a conclusion based on an observation.

00:02:07:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:07:090000.Dialogue: No, you don't. No, he doesn't.

00:02:10:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:10:090000.Dialogue: The girl they picked to play Mimi dropped out, and they asked me to replace her.

00:02:16:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:16:040000.Dialogue: It's not a big deal, just a one-night showcase, but they invite a lot of casting people. So, you never know.

00:02:25:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:25:130000.Dialogue: It's this Friday at 8:00. You want to come?

00:02:30:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:30:090000.Dialogue: Because... Friday we are attending a symposium on molecular positronium.

00:02:37:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:37:020000.Dialogue: I think that's a week from Tuesday, at 6:00.

00:02:42:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:42:220000.Dialogue: Too bad. I gotta get to rehearsal. See you guys.

00:02:59:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:59:150000.Dialogue: So, lack of a physiological response while lying is characteristic of a violent sociopath.

00:03:05:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:05:100000.Dialogue: Sheldon, are you worried about your safety?

00:03:07:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:07:170000.Dialogue: No, I imagine if you were going to kill me, you'd have done it a long time ago.

00:04:07:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:07:140000.Dialogue: I need to speak to you.

00:04:29:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:29:060000.Dialogue: You're right; it can wait until morning.

00:04:43:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:43:210000.Dialogue: I'm uncomfortable having been included in your lie to Penny.

00:04:47:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:47:130000.Dialogue: What was I supposed to say?

00:04:49:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:49:090000.Dialogue: That would have hurt her feelings.

00:04:57:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:57:090000.Dialogue: Then I suppose you could've agreed to go.

00:05:00:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:00:040000.Dialogue: And what would I have said afterwards?

00:05:02:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:02:060000.Dialogue: I would suggest something to the effect of: singing is neither an appropriate vocation nor avocation for you, and if you disagree, I'd recommend you have a CAT scan to look for a tumor pressing on the cognitive processing centers of your brain.

00:05:16:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:16:020000.Dialogue: I couldn't say that. I would have to say, You were terrific and I can't wait to hear you sing again.

00:05:24:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:24:100000.Dialogue: That's the social protocol. It's what you do when you have a friend who's proud of something they really suck at.

00:05:31:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:31:170000.Dialogue: I was not aware of that.

00:05:35:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:35:040000.Dialogue: All right. Leonard? When we played chess earlier, you were terrific, and I can't wait to play you again. Good night.

00:05:52:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:52:060000.Dialogue: This would be so much easier if I were a violent sociopath.

00:06:00:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:00:040000.Dialogue: I was analyzing our lie, and I believe we're in danger of Penny seeing through the ruse.

00:06:06:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:06:140000.Dialogue: Simple: If she were to log onto www.socalphysixsgroup.org /activities/other, click on Upcoming Events, scroll down to Seminars, download the PDF schedule, and look for the seminar on molecular positronium, bippity, boppity, boo-- our pants are metaphorically on fire.

00:06:27:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:27:180000.Dialogue: Well, sir, my trousers will not be igniting today.

00:06:39:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:39:190000.Dialogue: Do you have any idea what time it is?

00:06:41:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:41:220000.Dialogue: Of course I do. My watch is linked to the atomic clock in Boulder, Colorado. It's accurate to one-tenth of a second. But as I'm saying this, it occurs to me that, once again, your question may have been rhetorical.

00:06:55:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:55:220000.Dialogue: Remember how Leonard told you we couldn't come to your performance because we were attending a symposium on molecular positronium?

00:07:11:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:11:220000.Dialogue: He lied, and I'm feeling very uncomfortable about it.

00:07:23:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:23:150000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, this really isn't my strong suit.

00:07:27:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:27:050000.Dialogue: You told her I lied? Why would you tell her I lied?

00:07:33:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:33:180000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, I'm not seeing the help.

00:07:35:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:35:160000.Dialogue: She was going to see through your lie eventually, so I told her that you were lying to protect me.

00:07:47:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:47:070000.Dialogue: Indigestion? I'm sorry, I'm really not very good at this.

00:07:51:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:51:010000.Dialogue: Anyway, Penny now believes that, on Friday night, we're going to participate in my cousin Leopold's drug intervention.

00:08:00:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:00:230000.Dialogue: Who most people call Leo, but he also answers to Lee. Remember that. It's important.

00:08:06:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:06:130000.Dialogue: Details, Leonard-- the success or failure of our deceitful enterprise turns on details.

00:08:12:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:12:000000.Dialogue: Do you have a cousin Leopold?

00:08:16:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:16:060000.Dialogue: I think you'd call him Lee.

00:08:19:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:19:200000.Dialogue: I don't get it. I already told her a lie. Why replace it with a different lie?

00:08:24:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:24:110000.Dialogue: First of all, your lie was laughably transparent, where mine is exquisitely convoluted.

00:08:30:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:30:090000.Dialogue: While you were sleeping, I was weaving an un-unravelable web.

00:08:36:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:36:140000.Dialogue: Yes. If she Googles Leopold Houston, she'll find a Facebook page, an online blog depicting his descent into drug use and a desperate yet hopeful listing on eHarmony.com.

00:08:48:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:48:030000.Dialogue: Okay, why would I go to a drug intervention for your cousin?

00:08:52:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:52:010000.Dialogue: Because it's in Long Beach, and I don't drive.

00:08:56:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:56:150000.Dialogue: Of course not. There's no cousin Leo. There's no intervention. Focus, Leonard.

00:09:04:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:04:120000.Dialogue: We just leave the house on Friday night and we return in the wee hours, emotionally wrung out, from the work of convincing Leo to go back into rehab.

00:09:20:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:20:090000.Dialogue: You still told her I lied.

00:09:22:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:22:030000.Dialogue: For a noble purpose-- to spare me the social embarrassment of having a drug-addled first cousin-- which I'm assuming is embarrassing, yes?

00:09:31:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:31:200000.Dialogue: How am I supposed to remember all of this?

00:09:33:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:33:210000.Dialogue: That's the best part. You don't have to. I told Penny that you would be embarrassed if you knew that she found out that you had lied, so she's agreed to operate as if the original lie is still in force.

00:09:46:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:46:110000.Dialogue: So she's expecting me to lie about going to a symposium in Pasadena, when, in actuality, we're pretending to go to a drug intervention in Long Beach.

00:10:03:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:03:160000.Dialogue: Look at you, all ready for your showcase. You look great.

00:10:05:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:05:180000.Dialogue: Thanks. I just wanted to come by, wish you guys luck with your... symposium.

00:10:15:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:15:210000.Dialogue: I got to tell you, a lot of friends would let their friend go alone, but that's not who you are. You are the kind of guy who stands by a friend when... Wen he has a symposium to go to.

00:10:29:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:29:200000.Dialogue: I don't know what to say.

00:10:42:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:42:180000.Dialogue: Well, Penny is on her way to perform in a one-night showcase production of Rent, which we are unable to attend, because we're going to a symposium on molecular positronium given by Dr. Emil Farmanfarmian.

00:10:54:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:54:230000.Dialogue: Wait a minute. Farmanfarmian is speaking and you're bogarting the symposium?

00:11:05:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:05:130000.Dialogue: I don't know what to say.

00:11:09:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:09:110000.Dialogue: It's okay. It's your Millennium Falcon. You and Chewbacca do whatever you want to do.

00:11:15:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:15:190000.Dialogue: Me and Princess Leia here will find some other way to spend the evening.

00:11:21:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:21:060000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I think we should tell them.

00:11:25:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:25:100000.Dialogue: Okay, sure. I don't see a problem with that.

00:11:29:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:29:170000.Dialogue: There's no symposium. Leonard lied to me. Isn't that right, Leonard?

00:11:36:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:36:140000.Dialogue: I don't know what to say!

00:11:39:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:39:040000.Dialogue: It's okay; I do. Leonard is helping Sheldon through a family crisis. He made up the whole story about the symposium with Dr. Farman... farmian...

00:11:50:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:50:110000.Dialogue: ...he didn't want Sheldon to be embarrassed. And there's nothing to be embarrassed about. Every family in America has a relative holed up in a garage somewhere huffing paint thinner.

00:12:00:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:00:110000.Dialogue: No, I'm lost, too. I think she skipped a step.

00:12:04:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:04:230000.Dialogue: Sheldon's cousin Leo escaped rehab. He's in a Motel 8 in Long Beach. The whole family's going out for an intervention. Leonard is driving Sheldon down there to help him through this, because he's such a good man.

00:12:19:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:19:100000.Dialogue: All right, you guys, good luck.

00:12:25:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:25:040000.Dialogue: So, road trip to Long Beach.

00:12:26:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:26:220000.Dialogue: We're not going to Long Beach.

00:12:29:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:29:130000.Dialogue: Because Sheldon doesn't have a drug-addicted cousin Leopold.

00:12:35:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:35:070000.Dialogue: I've always wanted to go to Long Beach.

00:12:37:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:37:090000.Dialogue: It's a very nice community. The Queen Mary is docked there. Once the largest ocean liner in the world, it's now a hotel and restaurant, where they host a surprisingly gripping murder mystery dinner.

00:12:52:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:52:020000.Dialogue: Leonard gets nauseous unless he sits in front, and even then, it's iffy.

00:12:57:070000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:12:57:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:58:000000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.

00:13:10:200000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:13:10:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:10:200000.Dialogue: Let it go, Sheldon. The murderer was the first mate whether it makes sense to you or not.

00:13:17:030000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:13:17:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:17:030000.Dialogue: No, that's the least of our worries. I've been doing some research on addiction, both the biochemical and behavioral aspects-- and I think there's a problem with the current version of our lie.

00:13:26:210000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:13:26:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:26:210000.Dialogue: What are you talking about? It's fine! She bought it; it's over.

00:13:33:190000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:13:33:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:36:020000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:13:36:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:36:020000.Dialogue: Substance abuse is a lifelong struggle, but beyond that, I have realized that the Leo I described would not have agreed to go to rehab.

00:13:41:010000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:13:41:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:44:190000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:13:44:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:47:040000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:13:47:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:47:040000.Dialogue: There is no Leo! How can you say that?

00:13:53:120000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:13:53:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:53:120000.Dialogue: You didn't read the bio, did you?

00:13:56:150000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:13:56:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:56:150000.Dialogue: He's not just a middle child, he is the quintessential middle child-- from a broken home, to boot. Psychologically speaking, the attention he gets by rebelling, even to the point of self-destruction, is more emotionally valuable than the help he would get at rehab.

00:14:09:000000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:14:09:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:11:010000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:14:11:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:14:040000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:14:14:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:14:040000.Dialogue: Fine. I've hesitated to point this out, but I must now remind you that we are in our current predicament because of your initial and totally inadequate deceit. I'm just trying to clean up after your mess.

00:14:34:200000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
00:14:34:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:49:050000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:14:49:050000.Speaker: Strange man

00:14:51:110000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:14:51:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:53:170000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:14:53:170000.Speaker: Man

00:15:00:100000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:00:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:00:100000.Dialogue: Sheldon does not have a cousin Leo.

00:15:03:020000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:03:020000.Speaker: Man
00:15:03:020000.Dialogue: Au contraire. I'm 26 years old. I'm originally from... Denton, Texas,

00:15:10:120000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:10:120000.Speaker: Man
00:15:10:120000.Dialogue: but I was a Navy brat, so I was brought up on a variety of military bases around the world. As a result, I've often felt like an outsider-- never really fitting in, which is probably the reason for my substance abuse problem.

00:15:21:120000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:21:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:21:120000.Dialogue: Excuse me, we just went over this.

00:15:24:140000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:24:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:24:140000.Dialogue: As the quintessential middle child, your addiction is rooted in your unmet need for attention.

00:15:29:010000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:29:010000.Speaker: Man
00:15:29:010000.Dialogue: Sheldon, are we really going to go with pop psychology?

00:15:32:100000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:32:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:32:100000.Dialogue: For your information, this is based on solid research. Just stick with the character profile I wrote for you.

00:15:38:180000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:38:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:38:180000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. Leonard, this is Toby Loobenfeld. He's a research assistant in the particle physics lab, but he also minored in theater at MIT.

00:15:47:080000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:47:080000.Speaker: Toby
00:15:47:080000.Dialogue: It was more of a double major, actually. Theater and physics. You can guess which one my bourgeois parents pushed me toward.

00:15:53:230000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:53:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:53:230000.Dialogue: Yeah, I got it. Sheldon... why?

00:15:57:100000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:15:57:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:57:100000.Dialogue: You see, while Leo would not have gone into rehab, it is completely plausible that we would have talked him into leaving the motel and coming home with us.

00:16:07:100000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:16:07:100000.Speaker: Toby
00:16:07:100000.Dialogue: How about this as my motivation-- when I was 14 years old, I was abused in the Philippines by a clubfooted Navy chaplain.

00:16:15:220000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:16:15:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:15:220000.Dialogue: No. We're going with middle child and a genetic predisposition to inadequate serotonin production.

00:16:22:040000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:16:22:040000.Speaker: Toby
00:16:22:040000.Dialogue: Swell. How do I play genetic predisposition?

00:16:26:020000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:16:26:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:31:070000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:16:31:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:38:070000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:16:38:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:41:020000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:16:41:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:41:020000.Dialogue: Unfortunately, we weren't able to convince him to go to rehab.

00:16:44:160000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:16:44:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:44:160000.Dialogue: Based on what you told me, I am not surprised.

00:16:49:190000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:16:49:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:49:190000.Dialogue: But we did convince him to leave the motel. Come say hello. This is Penny, our friend and neighbor.

00:17:00:010000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:00:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:00:010000.Dialogue: Hi, Leo. How are you feeling?

00:17:08:080000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:08:080000.Speaker: Toby
00:17:08:080000.Dialogue: Let me ask you something, Penny. Have you ever woken up in a fleabag motel, covered in your own vomit, next to a transsexual prostitute?

00:17:21:030000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:21:030000.Speaker: Toby
00:17:21:030000.Dialogue: Then don't ask me how I'm feeling.

00:17:26:230000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:26:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:30:060000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:30:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:30:060000.Dialogue: why don't you tell me about your showcase last night.

00:17:32:230000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:32:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:32:230000.Dialogue: It was okay, I guess. It wasn't a big turnout, but they both really seemed to like it.

00:17:37:060000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:37:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:37:060000.Dialogue: There were only two people there?

00:17:39:020000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:39:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:42:050000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:42:050000.Speaker: Toby

00:17:46:150000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:46:150000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:48:040000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:48:040000.Speaker: Toby

00:17:52:010000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:17:52:010000.Speaker: Toby
00:17:52:010000.Dialogue: Laughing The Subic Bay Naval Station. A young boy on the cusp of manhood.

00:18:00:000000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:00:000000.Speaker: Toby
00:18:00:000000.Dialogue: His only companions, mongrel dogs and malarial mosquitoes. Desperate and alone, he reached out to a man who promised to introduce him to a merciful, loving God, but who instead introduced him to a gin-pickled tongue shoved down his adolescent throat.

00:18:22:010000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:22:010000.Speaker: Toby
00:18:22:010000.Dialogue: What choice did he have but to drink, shoot and snort his pain away?

00:18:29:160000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:29:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:29:160000.Dialogue: Don't forget his genetic predisposition towards addiction.

00:18:32:060000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:32:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:34:110000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:34:110000.Speaker: Toby

00:18:36:010000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:36:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:36:010000.Dialogue: How could there be? Who would be the control group?

00:18:38:170000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:38:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:38:170000.Dialogue: As you can see, detoxing can get pretty ugly. Let's give them some privacy.

00:18:43:020000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:43:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:43:020000.Dialogue: Do you want to come over and have coffee?

00:18:45:020000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:45:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:46:090000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:46:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:46:090000.Dialogue: I have a video of me singing last night. Do you want to see it?

00:18:50:080000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:50:080000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:53:020000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:53:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:53:020000.Dialogue: It's even better than you coming to the showcase, now I get to watch you watch me.

00:18:58:200000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:18:58:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:19:02:020000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:19:02:020000.Speaker: Toby
00:19:02:020000.Dialogue: ...but he loved the companionship and the wisdom that his own father failed to provide.

00:19:08:010000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:19:08:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:08:010000.Dialogue: Your parents made the right decision.

00:19:15:190000.Scene: The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
00:19:15:190000.Speaker: Toby

00:19:27:120000.Scene: The apartment. Penny is on the sofa with Toby. They are watching TV.
00:19:27:120000.Speaker: Toby
00:19:27:120000.Dialogue: This is amazing. Just sitting on a couch watching TV with a woman. Not being drunk or high or wondering if you're a dude down there.

00:19:40:130000.Scene: The apartment. Penny is on the sofa with Toby. They are watching TV.
00:19:40:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:40:130000.Dialogue: Leo, you are a very sweet, really funny guy. You're going to do okay.

00:19:46:180000.Scene: The apartment. Penny is on the sofa with Toby. They are watching TV.
00:19:46:180000.Speaker: Toby
00:19:46:180000.Dialogue: One day at a time, Penny.

00:19:52:110000.Scene: The apartment. Penny is on the sofa with Toby. They are watching TV.
00:19:52:110000.Speaker: Toby

00:19:59:050000.Scene: The apartment. Penny is on the sofa with Toby. They are watching TV.
00:19:59:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:59:050000.Dialogue: How long is he going to stay here?

00:20:02:010000.Scene: The apartment. Penny is on the sofa with Toby. They are watching TV.
00:20:02:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:02:010000.Dialogue: He's a homeless drug addict. Where is he going to go?

00:20:06:000000.Scene: The apartment. Penny is on the sofa with Toby. They are watching TV.
00:20:06:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:06:000000.Dialogue: Boy, you have a lot to learn about lying.
